title: Electric potential - -4 nC and 5 nC point charges

content.question: Two point charges are located on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, as shown in the figure. A <math alttext="negative 4 nancoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>4.0</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge is at <math alttext="x equals negative 0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>0.20</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, and a <math alttext="positive 5.0 nancoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge is at <math alttext="x equals positive 0.10 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>0.10</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. What is the electric potential on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis at <math alttext="x equals 0.00 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.00</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>? Take the potential to be zero at an infinite distance from the point charges.

choices.label: <math alttext="270 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>270</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="630 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>630</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="3600 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="5400 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="270 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>270</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
